{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child is afebrile with normal muscle mass, tone, and reflexes, ruling out GBS (Guillain-Barré syndrome) and DMD (Duchenne muscular dystrophy) which typically present with muscle weakness and neurological deficits. The child has muscle pain on palpation and elevated CPK levels, suggesting muscle inflammation. This is consistent with the diagnosis of acute viral myositis. Dermatomyositis is a possibility, but it typically presents with characteristic skin rash, which is not mentioned in the case. Therefore, the most likely diagnosis is acute viral myositis.", "answer_choice": "D. Acute viral myositis"}
